title: Semantria
description: Semantria applies Text and Sentiment Analysis to tweets, facebook posts, surveys, reviews or enterprise content.

count.description: The count of occurrences of the attribute across the documents

mentions.description: Returns genuine forms of attribute mentioned across the documents

categories.description: List of sub-categories of the current category if applicable

sentiment_polarity.description: Verbal representation of sentiment score. Can be "negative", "positive" or "neutral"

sentiment_score.description: The sentiment score associated with this category

strength_score.description: Strength of the category matches with the document content

title.description: The category title, which is its label in the text

type.description: Type of category; can be either "node" (root level) or "leaf" (nested) value

modified.description: The timestamp of the latest update of the record. Creation date of update didn't occur
The timestamp of the latest update of the record. Creation date of update didn't occur

documents.description: List of documents text that need to be analyzed by the service

id.description: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client

job_id.description: Specific marker of incoming job that can be used then for collections retrieving

metadata.description: Free form metadata object(JSON) attached to the certain collection

tag.description: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker

config_id.description: Unique configuration identifier. Usually 36 alphanumeric characters

docs_count.description: Count of the documents the collection consist of

entities.description: Returns the named entities and user defined entities from the text

facets.description: Returns the facets extracted across all documents in the collection

id.description: Unique collection identifier. Can be up to 36 alphanumeric characters

job_id.description: Specific marker of a job collection belongs to, can be used for collections ordering on client side.

metadata.description: Free form metadata object(JSON) attached to the certain collection

tag.description: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker

taxonomy.description: Returns the taxonomy determined for the text

topics.description: Returns the concept and query defined topics determined for the text

attributes.description: Defines whether attributes for facets will be reported for the collection. Default: true

concept_topics.description: Defines whether user_categories will be reported for the collection. Default: false

facets.description: Defines whether facets will be reported for the collection. Default: true

mentions.description: Defines whether mentions for themes, user/named entities, facets and attributes will be reported for the collection. Default: false

named_entities.description: Defines whether named entities will be reported for the collection. Default: true

query_topics.description: Defines whether queries will be reported for the collection. Default: true

themes.description: Defines whether themes will be reported for the collection. Default: true

user_entities.description: Defines whether user entities will be reported for the collection. Default: true

auto_categories.description: Defines whether auto-categories will be reported for the document. Default: true

concept_topics.description: Defines whether user categories will be reported for the document. Default: false

detect_language.description: Switches on language detection feature. Default: true

intentions.description: Switches on intentions detection feature. Default: false

mentions.description: Defines whether mentions for themes and user/named entities will be reported for the document. Default: false

model_sentiment.description: Switches on/off model-based sentiment feature. Default: false

named_entities.description: Defines whether named entities will be reported for the document. Default: true

opinions.description: Defines whether user/named entity opinions will be reported for the document. Default: false

pos_types.description: Defines parts-of-speech which will be responded by the server

query_topics.description: Defines whether queries will be reported for the document. Default: true

relations.description: Defines whether user/named entity relations will be reported for the document. Default: false

sentiment_phrases.description: Defines whether sentiment-bearing phrases will be reported for the document. Default: true

summary_size.description: Limits the number of sentences for the document summary feature.  Default: 3

themes.description: Defines whether document and user/named entity themes will be reported for the document. Default: false

user_entities.description: Defines whether user entities will be reported for the document. Default: true

alphanumeric_threshold.description: Defines the threshold of alphanumeric characters needed in the text in percent. Default: 80

auto_response.description: Defines whether or not the service should respond with processed results automatically. Default: false

callback.description: Defines a callback URL for automatic data responding

collection.description: Includes options related to collection processing mode

concept_topics_threshold.description: Defines concept topics detection threshold. Default: 0.45

document.description: Includes options related to document processing mode

entities_threshold.description: Defines low threshold for evidence score of named and user entities to be reported in the output. Default: 55

is_primary.description: Identifies whether the current configuration is primary or not. Default: false

language.description: Defines target language that will be used for task processing. Default: English

one_sentence_mode.description: Defines whether or not service should use one sentence mode with less accurate grammar. Default: false

process_html.description: Defines whether or not the service should clean up HTML tags before processing. Default: false

alphanumeric_threshold.description: Defines the threshold for alphanumeric characters in the text in percent. Default: 80

auto_response.description: Defines whether or not the service should respond with processed results automatically. Default: false

callback.description: Defines a callback URL for automatic data responding

collection.description: Includes options related to collection processing mode

concept_topics_threshold.description: Defines concept topics detection threshold. Default: 0.45

document.description: Includes options related to document processing mode

entities_threshold.description: Defines low threshold for evidence score of named and user entities to be reported in the output. Default: 55

is_primary.description: Identifies whether the current configuration is primary or not. Default: false

language.description: Defines target language that will be used for task processing. Default: English

modified.description: The timestamp of the latest update of the record. Creation date of update didn't occur

one_sentence_mode.description: Defines whether or not service should use one sentence mode with less accurate grammar. Default: false

process_html.description: Defines whether or not the service should clean up HTML tags before processing. Default: false

template.description: Unique identifier of template configuration if copy operation is performing

version.description: Version of the vertical pack, for versioning purposes

alphanumeric_threshold.description: Defines the threshold of alphanumeric characters needed in the text in percent. Default: 80

auto_response.description: Defines whether or not the service should respond with processed results automatically. Default: false

callback.description: Defines a callback URL for automatic data responding

collection.description: Includes options related to collection processing mode

concept_topics_threshold.description: Defines concept topics detection threshold. Default: 0.45

document.description: Includes options related to document processing mode

entities_threshold.description: Defines low threshold for evidence score of named and user entities to be reported in the output. Default: 55

is_primary.description: Identifies whether the current configuration is primary or not. Default: false

language.description: Defines target language that will be used for task processing. Default: English

one_sentence_mode.description: Defines whether or not service should use one sentence mode with less accurate grammar. Default: false

process_html.description: Defines whether or not the service should clean up HTML tags before processing. Default: false

is_imperative.description: Represents whether sentence (group of words) is imperative or not

is_polar.description: Represents whether or not sentence content contains sentiment polarity

words.description: Returns list of words grouped by the parent sentence

id.description: Up to 32 symbols unique identifier of document assigned and tracked by client.

job_id.description: Specific marker of incoming job that can be used then for documents retrieving

metadata.description: Free form metadata object(JSON) attached to the certain document

tag.description: Any text of up to 50 characters used like marker.

text.description: Document text that needs to be analyzed by the service.

auto_categories.description: Auto-generated categories applicable for the document

config_id.description: Unique configuration identifier. Usually 36 alphanumeric characters

details.description: Returns sentences from the original document with POS tags within

entities.description: Returns the named entities and user defined entities from the text

id.description: Unique document identifier. Can be up to 36 alphanumeric characters

intentions.description: Returns intentions list detected by the engine

job_id.description: Specific marker of a job document belongs to, can be used for documents ordering on client side

language_score.description: The percentage score of the best match of language among detected languages

metadata.description: Free form metadata object(JSON) attached to the certain document

model_sentiment.description: Returns details of model-based sentiment analysis for the document

opinions.description: Returns the list of opinions extracted from the source text

phrases.description: Returns sentiment-bearing phrases of the document

relations.description: Returns relations which represent a connection between one or more Entity objects

sentiment_polarity.description: Verbal representation of sentiment score. Can be "negative", "positive" or "neutral"

sentiment_score.description: A sentiment analysis of the document text

source_text.description: Original source text passed by client for this document

summary.description: A summary of the document text

topics.description: Returns the concept and query defined topics determined for the text

entity_type.description: Type of the entity (Company, Person, Place, Product, etc.)

label.description: Descriptive label for the entity, if applicable

neutral_count.description: The count of neutral occurrences of the entity across the documents

positive_count.description: The count of positive occurrences of the entity across the documents

title.description: Normalized form of the entity. It is the normalized entity title

type.description: Type of the entity; can be either “named” or “user” (reserved for future usage)

label.description: Descriptive label for the entity, e.g. Wikipedia URL

normalized.description: Normalized form of the entity. Will replace entity name in the output

config_id.description: Unique identifier of configuration associated with the vertical pack. Required for cloning

description.description: Verbal description of template features, belonging to domain area, etc.

id.description: Unique document identifier. Can be up to 36 alphanumeric characters

is_free.description: Shows whether Vertical pack is free or requires subscription

language.description: The language supported by the vertical pack

type.description: The type of the vertical pack, can be either "vertical-pack" or "language-default"

version.description: Version of the vertical pack, for versioning purposes.

evidence_phrase.description: The phrase which expressed the intention

type.description: The classification of the intention detected (buy, quit, etc.)

what.description: The object of the intention (if detected)

who.description: The author of the intention (if detected)

index.description: Document index within collection where the mention appeared

length.description: The length of the mention in bytes

offset.description: The amount of bytes offset in the original text before the start of the mention

is_negated.description: Indicates whether or not the mention has been negated

label.description: The text of the attribute mention

locations.description: List of coordinates of the mentions found within the collection

negating_phrase.description: If the mention has been negated, this gives the negating phrase

mixed_score.description: Mixed sentiment score associated with the document

model_name.description: Name of the sentiment model used for scoring

negative_score.description: Negative (probable negative score) sentiment score associated with the document

neutral_score.description: Neutral (probable neutral score) sentiment score associated with the document

positive_score.description: Positive (probable positive score) sentiment score associated with the document

sentiment_polarity.description: Verbal representation of sentiment score that matches the best on the document. Can be "negative", "positive" or "neutral"

quotation.description: The text of the expressed opinion

sentiment_polarity.description: Verbal representation of sentiment score. Can be "negative", "positive" or "neutral"

sentiment_score.description: The sentiment score associated with the opinion

speaker.description: An entity title identifying the author of the opinion

topic.description: An entity title identifying the subject of the opinion, if applicable

type.description: Type of opinion according to extracted entity

intensifying_phrase.description: If the phrase has been intensified, this gives the intensifying phrase

is_intensified.description: Specifies whether the phrase has been intensified or not

is_negated.description: Specifies whether the phrase has been negated or not

length.description: The length of the phrase in bytes

negating_phrase.description: If the phrase has been negated, this gives the negating phrase

offset.description: The amount of bytes offset in the original text before the start of the phrase

sentiment_polarity.description: Verbal representation of sentiment score. Can be "negative", "positive" or "neutral"

sentiment_score.description: The sentiment score associated with this phrase

title.description: The text of the sentiment-bearing phrase

type.description: Type of phrase; can be either "possible" or "detected" value

query.description: Boolean query used for content categorization

query.description: Boolean query used for content categorization
Boolean query used for content categorization

confidence_score.description: A measure of confidence in the relationship extraction

entities.description: Returns entities which presents parent relationship

extra.description: Extra information that has been extracted about the relationship

relation_type.description: A label describing the nature of the relationship

type.description: Type of relation according to extracted entities

title.description: Normalized entity title based on existing entity normalization rules

batches_queued.description: Total number of queued batches of texts processed

calls_data.description: Total number of data API calls made. These affect you API balance

calls_polling.description: Total number of polling API calls made

calls_settings.description: Total number of settings API calls made. These do not affect API balance

docs_failed.description: Total number of documents that have failed to be processed

docs_queued.description: Total number of documents that have been queued

docs_retrieved.description: Total number of successfully processed documents that have been returned

docs_successful.description: Total number of documents that have been successfully processed

latest_used_app.description: The latest application that used the API on this account

total_api_calls.description: Total number of API calls made

batches_queued.description: Number of queued batches of texts using certain configuration

calls_data.description: Number of data API calls made  using certain configuration. These affect you API balance

calls_polling.description: Number of polling API calls made using certain configuration. These do not affect API balance

calls_settings.description: Number of settings API calls made  using certain configuration. These do not affect API balance

config_id.description: Unique identifier of configuration

docs_failed.description: Number of documents that have failed to be processed using certain configuration

docs_queued.description: Number of documents that have been queued using certain configuration

docs_retrieved.description: Number of successfully processed documents which have been returned using certain configuration

docs_successful.description: Number of documents that have been successfully processed using certain configuration

latest_used_app.description: The latest application used by certain configuration

total_api_calls.description: Number of API calls made  using certain configuration

api_version.description: Represents current version of the exposed API

service_status.description: Represents the availability of the service

service_version.description: Represents current version of the Semantria service

supported_compression.description: Exposes supported compression algorithms. Currently only gzip and deflate are supported

supported_encoding.description: Exposes supported content encoding. Currently only UTF-8 is supported

strength_score.description: Strength of the category matches with the document content

title.description: The category title, which is its label in the text

type.description: Type of category; can be either "node" (root level) or "leaf" (nested) value

basic_settings.description: Includes basic settings of current subscription

billing_settings.description: Billing related settings of current subscription

feature_settings.description: Includes features related settings of current subscription

status.description: Semantria subscriber status. Can be active, expired, disabled, etc

auto_response_batch_limit.description: Represents the maximum size of outgoing batch for auto-response feature

blacklist_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of allowed blacklist items

callback_batch_limit.description: Represents the maximum size of outgoing batch for callback data retrieving mode

collection_limit.description: Represents the maximum size of collection in documents

concept_topic_samples_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of allowed user category samples

concept_topics_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of allowed user categories

configurations_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of allowed configurations

document_length.description: Represents the maximum length of the document allowed for processing

incoming_batch_limit.description: Represents the maximum size of the incoming batch of documents

near_operator_distance.description: Represents the maximum allowed distance that can be used with NEAR operator

near_operator_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of NEAR operators that can appear in query/entity/phrase

polling_batch_limit.description: Represents the maximum size of outgoing batch for polling data retrieving mode

queries_depth_level.description: Represents the maximum depth level allowed for nested and referenced queries

query_topics_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of allowed queries

return_source_text.description: Indicates whether responding of source text along with the analysis data is allowed or not

sentiment_phrases_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of allowed sentiment-bearing phrases

summary_size_limit.description: Represent the maximum number allowed as output limit of configuration

taxonomy_depth_limit.description: Represents the maximum depth level allowed for nested taxonomy nodes

taxonomy_limit.description: Represents the number of nodes allowed for entire taxonomy tree

taxonomy_topics_limit.description: Represents the maximum allowed number of topics associated with the certain taxonomy node

user_entities_limit.description: Represents the maximum number of allowed user entities

app_seats_allocated.description: Number of allocated application cells permitted to work with the API

app_seats_permitted.description: Number of permitted application to work with the same API account

data_calls_balance.description: Represents actual value of remained data API calls

data_calls_limit.description: Represents the limit of data API calls per "data_calls_limit_interval" value

data_calls_limit_interval.description: Represents an interval for the "data_calls_limit" value of current subscription

docs_balance.description: Current transaction balance. Applicable for pay-as-you-go subscriptions only

expiration_date.description: Expiration date of current subscription. Defined as a Unix time stamp

job_ids_allocated.description: Number of job Ids currently allocated on the server by the certain subscription

job_ids_permitted.description: Number of job Ids allowed for the certain subscription

polling_calls_balance.description: Represents actual value of remained polling API calls

polling_calls_limit.description: Represents the limit of polling API calls per "polling_calls_limit_interval" value

polling_calls_limit_interval.description: Represents an interval for the "polling_calls_limit" value of current subscription

settings_calls_balance.description: Represents actual value of remained settings API calls

settings_calls_limit.description: Represents the limit of settings API calls per "settings_calls_limit_interval" value

settings_calls_limit_interval.description: Represents an interval for the "settings_calls_limit" value of current subscription

actions.title: deleteBlacklistItems
actions.description: This method removes certain blacklisted items by their values on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration blacklist items linked to.

actions.title: getBlacklist
actions.description: This method retrieves all backlisted items available on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration blacklist linked to.

actions.title: addBlacklist
actions.description: This method adds new unique items to the backlist on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration blacklist linked to.

actions.title: updateBlacklist
actions.description: This method updates existing items by unique IDs in the backlist on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration blacklist linked to.

actions.title: deleteCategories
actions.description: This method removes certain user categories by their IDs on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration user categories linked to.

actions.title: getCategories
actions.description: This method retrieves list of user categories available on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration user categories linked to.

actions.title: addCategories
actions.description: This method adds user categories on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration user categories linked to.

actions.title: updateCategories
actions.description: This method updates user categories by unique IDs on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration user categories linked to.

actions.title: queueCollection
actions.description: This method queues collection of documents onto the server for analysis. Queued collection of documents analyzes in common context as entire thing. If unique configuration ID provided, Semantria uses settings of that configuration during analysis, in opposite the primary configuration uses. Collection IDs are unique in scope of configuration. If the same ID appears twice, Semantria overrides existing collection with the new Data

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: retrieveProcessedCollections
actions.description: This method retrieves analysis results for processed collections from Semantria. FAILED collections will have FAILED status in response. Semantria responds with limited amount of results per API call. If configuration ID provided, Semantria responds with the collections, which were queued using the same configuration ID, in opposite Primary configuration uses.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: cancelCollection
actions.description: This method cancels collection analysis by unique ID on Semantria side if it is waiting for analysis in queue.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: receiveCollectionAnalyticData
actions.description: This method retrieves analysis results for documents collection by its unique ID or the collection’s status in queue if it did not analyzed yet. Semantria guarantees delivering of all collections back to the client even if they FAILED on Semantria side due to some reason.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: deleteConfigurations
actions.description: This method removes certain configuration by unique ID on Semantria side.

actions.title: getConfigurations
actions.description: This method retrieves all user configurations available on Semantria side.

actions.title: addConfigurations
actions.description: This method creates configurations on Semantria side.

actions.title: updateConfigurations
actions.description: This method updates specific configurations by unique IDs on Semantria side.

actions.title: queueDocument
actions.description: This method queues document onto the server for analysis. Queued document analyzes individually and will have its own set of results. If unique configuration ID provided, Semantria uses settings of that configuration during analysis, in opposite the primary configuration uses. Document IDs are unique in scope of configuration. If the same ID appears twice, Semantria overrides existing document with the new Data.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: queueBatchOfDocuments
actions.description: This method queues batch of documents for analysis. The rules are the same as for single document mode but here the documents ordered into the batch.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: retrieveProcessedDocuments
actions.description: This method retrieves analysis results for processed documents from Semantria. FAILED documents will have FAILED status in response. Semantria responds with limited amount of results per API call. If configuration ID provided, Semantria responds with the document, which were queued using the same configuration ID, in opposite Primary.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: cancelDocument
actions.description: This method cancels document analysis by unique ID on Semantria side if it is waiting for analysis in queue.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: receiveDocumentAnalyticData
actions.description: This method retrieves analysis results for the single document by its unique ID or the document’s status in queue if it did not analyzed yet. Semantria guarantees delivering of all documents back to the client even if they FAILED on Semantria side due to some reason.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration used for analysis.

actions.title: deleteEntities
actions.description: This method removes certain user entities by their names on Semantria side.

actions.title: getEntities
actions.description: This method retrieves list of user entities available on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration user entities linked to.

actions.title: addEntities
actions.description: This method adds user entities on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration user entities linked to.

actions.title: updateEntities
actions.description: This method updates user entities by unique IDs on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration user entities linked to.

actions.title: getFeatures
actions.description: This method returns list of supported features per languages supported by Semantria API. Let the users know about API capabilities.

actions.title: deletePhrases
actions.description: This method removes certain sentiment-bearing phrases by their names on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration phrases linked to.

actions.title: getPhrases
actions.description: This method retrieves list of sentiment-bearing phrases available on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration phrases linked to.

actions.title: addPhrases
actions.description: This method adds sentiment-bearing phrases on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration phrases linked to.

actions.title: updatePhrases
actions.description: This method updates sentiment-bearing phrases by unique IDs on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration phrases linked to.

actions.title: deleteQueries
actions.description: This method removes certain queries by their IDs on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration queries linked to.

actions.title: getQueries
actions.description: This method retrieves list of queries available on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration queries linked to.

actions.title: addQueries
actions.description: This method adds queries on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration queries linked to.

actions.title: updateQueries
actions.description: This method updates queries by unique IDs on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration queries linked to.

actions.title: getStatistic
actions.description: This method retrieves overall and per configuration usage statistics for specific timeframe. Statistics ordered per available configurations. Available interval values are current hour, day, week, month and year.

config_id.description: Configuration identifier for usage statistics retrieving.

interval.description: Hour, Day, Week, Month, Year values are supported.

actions.title: getStatus
actions.description: This method retrieves API status information such as the app version, current API version, supported languages and encodings, the overall service status, etc.

actions.title: getSubscription
actions.description: This method retrieves user's subscription details that consist of the list of allowed features, configured limits and options on Semantria side.

actions.title: deleteTaxonomy
actions.description: This method removes certain taxonomy nodes by their IDs on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration queries linked to.

actions.title: getTaxonomy
actions.description: This method retrieves list of taxonomy available on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration taxonomy linked to.

actions.title: addTaxonomy
actions.description: This method adds taxonomy nodes on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration queries linked to.

actions.title: updateTaxonomy
actions.description: This method updates taxonomy nodes on Semantria side.

config_id.description: Identifier of configuration queries linked to.
